hackathon-description-text: Join the MIT Bitcoin Expo in building our decentralized future. We will be bringing together 250 developers, hackers, and industry expert from around the world to compete in a 24-hour hackathon to build the best decentralized technology for Web 3.0. This year, the MIT Bitcoin Hackathon will be taking place March 16-17, 2018. We'll be providing hackers with free food, travel reimbusements, prizes, and opportunities to present their projects to top industry judges at the annual MIT Bitcoin Expo.
hackathon-eligibility: Participants must be university students or professionals.
hackathon-requirements: Submissions should include the project description and, if possible, a link to a working demo.
hackathon-rules:
Teams must be 1-6 members.
All code must be written during the hackathon.
 
Participant Liability Waiver:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/lfjveqbtmsh8wjx/MIT%20Bitcoin%20Hackathon%20Liability%20Waiver.pdf

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $5000 in Bitcoin, mentorship from VCs, and presentation at the MIT Bitcoin Expo to the best project of the hackathon
$4000 in Bitcoin and presentation at the MIT Bitcoin Expo to the team awarded second place
$3000 in Bitcoin and presentation at the MIT Bitcoin Expo to the team awarded third place
Top seven teams will be selected to present at the MIT Bitcoin Expo
$2500 to the team that best utilizes Dharma Protocol
$5000 in Gas to the team with the project that best uses NEO smart contract
$3000 to the team with the best social impact project
$3000 in Bitcoin to the team that best utilizes Bitcoin
$5000 to the team with the most impressive cryptofinancial use cases on Ethereum, especially those using multi-token smart contracts.
$2500 awarded to the team with the best implementation of one of the following challenges:
$5000 to the team that best utilizes NuCypher

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=32 Vassar St, Cambridge, MA 02139, USA
hackathon-description-header: Join us in building the next generation of cryptocurrency and blockchain technology! March 16-17 at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
